notes: I open up with a familiar but slightly modified routine.
Of course, as expected Abu knows just the people for the job!
The next day I send Abu an email containing 6 very high resolutions scans of streetmaps and further instructions.
Post my maps to Abu? That would involve spending money. That's not going to happen here buddy!
Well, two weeks later Abu finally sends in the hand drawn map samples.
Two weeks later, Abu decides he's not up to the job.
Time to give Abu a bit of a scare to prompt some action.
'Prophet' Ubabuike gets in touch.
Ubabuike lets me know the first set of maps are complete.
The prophet doesn't take kindly to my critique'.
Two days later, the new scans arrive.
Time to give Ubabuike a little encouragement.
A few days later Ubabuike gets back in touch.
Lets see if I can get this guy to do some more work!
No reply for quite a while. I though I had lost Ubabuike but he replies just as I was about to give up on him.
A few days go by and then then the identification and sworn oaths arrive.
I want to know how my circuit diagrams are going.
Seems Ubabuike thinks he's getting his payment before I receive my new samples from him.
I'll just ignore his request and ask about my samples again.
Over a week later and I finally get a reply.
I think Ubabuike may be getting slightly suspicious!
Two days later and Ubabuike seems to be questioning my honesty. How dare he!
Time to put this guy in his place.

The circuit diagram samples have obviously been drawn in haste and definitely not by the same people that drew the previous maps. I suspect that Ubabuike himself drew the circuit diagrams. Perhaps the map guys wanted some cash upfront before working for him again! Anyway, they are totally unacceptable, and I think it's time we let him know it. Arthur Dent is taking a short break, so step in Dirk Gently.
Ubabuike didn't reply to Dirk, so a few days later Arthur Dent gets in touch.
title: Get Mapping

BTCIBANK, LOME- TOGO.

I am Mr. Abu, from the western part of TOGO LOME working with the above bank.

our banking and financial policies but unfortunately we learnt that his supposed next of kin or relation died along side with him in the crash leaving no body behind to claim the money.

It is therefore upon this discovery that I as the head of this accounting department to make this business proposal to you and release the money to you as the next of kin or relation to the deceased for safety and subsequent disbursement since nobody is coming for it and we don't want this money to go into the Bank treasury as unclaimed bills.Do not view this as been illegal but to help people like us that have no hope in life instead of the bank converting this much money to the security funds of the bank because if you dont assist us the bank will lay hold on this money.

The Banking law and guideline here stipulates that if such money remained unclaimed after long period, the money will be transferred into the Bank treasury as unclaimed fund.The total sum in question is:US$14 million US dollars (FOURTEEN MILLION UNITED STATES DOLLARS)The request for a foreigner as next of kin in this business is occasioned by the fact that the customer was a foreigner and an indegine cannot stand as next of kin to the deceased family and moreover we as bankers are not allowed by law to operate foreign accounts. Therefore to enable the immediate transfer of this fund to you as arranged into your account, there are certain banking protocols to be followed in which I am very ready to furnish you with details and guide you accordingly.

However, note that this business is 100% risk free, and I am prepared to offer you 35% for your assistance in this business, 60% for me and 5% for transfer expence to tranfer the fund into your account. The following website shows the extent of my discovery in which I saw the deceased name and families included and the next of kin dying along with everyone, hence leaving no next of kin. The above website is for your own sighting for you to have full knowledge of the venture and partnership we are about bring together in unity and oneness of mind towards good success.

Proof if any more were needed that these scammers have no soul, no pity, and no depths to which they will not sink to steal money from people, using the tragic deaths of thousands of innocent people as a tool for their scams.

* AUTHORISATION CERTIFICATE OF MR JOHN SCHELPERT

Your partner and friend,

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Abu Moses
Date: January 25, 2006

Dear Mr. Moses,

Thank you very much for you interesting email, it was kind of you to contact me with your proposition.

Unfortunately I am not in a position to help you at this point in time as my company are conducting a very important 4 year long research project on Advanced Handwriting Recognition and Graphology systems. Our work is extremely intensive and vitally important for our clients. They have committed over eight million dollars to our project and we are nearing the final stages. After nearly 4 years of research and development we are now only three months away from the conclusion and I am afraid I can allow nothing to interfere with the project until its completion.

Just for your information we are currently looking for new employees with map drafting skills to reproduce maps by hand from copies that we provide. We are offering three-year contracts to suitable applicants:

Job Title: Map Transcribers
Office: Cartography Department
Period: 3 years with a 1 year contract extension every 12 months
Salary: US $173,000.00 per annum base with bonuses
Positions available: x5

If you know of anyone who may be suitable for such a position then please do contact me. Of course we would need to meet with them for an interview but we will be happy to pay all travel expenses in advance, along with all hotel booking fees etc.

Once again I am sorry I can not help you with your proposition.

Sincerely,

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Abu Moses
Date: January 25, 2006

Dear Mr. Moses,

Thank you very much for your prompt reply, it is appreciated.

We are happy to accept people from any part of the world so long as their skills are demonstrate, so if your contacts are from West Africa then that will not present any problems at all. We already employ for people from Nairobi, Kenya, and they do extremely good work, so I would be very interested if you have people who are qualified for such work.

Let me explain what the project requires:

My company are involved in advanced handwriting recognition systems. We are a multimillion dollar company, and presently we are looking for trainee cartographers. Although most road and street map are of course these days created on computer systems, we have a requirement to create systems that can recognise hand drawn maps. Many maps have to be drawn by hand because of various reasons, such as the location is not suitable for the setting up of computerised cartography systems etc. These hand drawn maps are then brought to us and our recognition systems convert the hand drawn maps into professional computerised maps.

So, what we require are people who have the ability to draw by hand copies of street or roadmaps for us to test and train our computer recognition systems on.

We require people who are proficient at copying/drawing by hand, copies of maps. If you think you have people who are qualified to do such work then we would certainly be very interested in inviting them over to discuss various employment packages.

We would of course be willing to pay all expenses in advance including of course flight tickets etc, however before we would be willing to interview them here we would require a small sample of their work to be sent to us by email attachment. We would send you a sample streetmap my email attachment and your people would need to make a copy of the maps BY HAND in as much detail as possible and then return a scan of their work by email attachment. If the work is acceptable then we would immediately give your people an invitation to come and meet with us, and of course send your travel expenses etc. by whatever way best suits your means.

Please signal your agreement to our terms and then I will forward you a sample map to copy. Also please inform me how many people you have that would like to apply for the available positions. Currently we have 10 positions available, however I expect these positions to be filled quite quickly.

You may contact me on +44 8707 XXX XXX if you require further instructions.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.subject: Gods given vision
messages.raw:
From: Abu Moses
To: Arthur Dent
Date: January 26, 2006
Subject: Gods given vision

Sir,

It seems like a dream,but it is a reality.It is a dream-come-true.What I thought was a lost vision,turned out to be God's directed vision. Self-trust is the first secret of success.I ask for what I want,but I am willing to take what God gives me.It may be best than what I ask for.I learn to let God run my life.

The results will be best than myself runing my life. A wise investor is one who searches for good opportunity and not just any opportunity.A man who lacks good counseling will always make mistakes in his investments.

"He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool;but who so walked wisely,he shall be delivered" (proverb 28vs26).

Back to our project: Stealing cash from unsuspecting victims!

Sir,

I have to come down to Lagos and make contact on people that I know well who are proficient at copying/drawing by hand,Copies of maps.I have Six people who are qualified to do such work for you now. You can send the samples of a street map by E-mail attachment and I will travel with it to Lagos where I have such people to discuss with them face to face. My people would need to make a copy of the maps by hand in as much details as possible and then return a scan of their work by E-mail attachment to you.So forward to me a sample map to copy.

Currently I have six and I hope when I get to Lagos the 10 positions available will be filled quite quickly by God's grace.

I am serious about wanting employment for good people of God.I will use my two weeks holidays to work for the success of this project.Please promise me that you will show gratitude for all my hard work and kind assistance and that you will help to mobilize me when I am in Lagos I will call your personal office line no:+44 8707 XXX XXX

Let me know your minimum Education Requirements,Age,Male or Female.

Thanks.

Abu Moses.

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Abu Moses
Date: January 27, 2006

Dear Mr. Moses,

Thank you once again for your reply.

It is good to learn that you may have six people with the required skills to submit samples to us for inspection. It would suit my company very well indeed if we were able to employ a large group from the same location as this would cut down very significantly on paperwork and other matters.

However each applicant must submit a different sample, so shortly I will forward to you six different map samples for them to work on, along with further instructions.

Education, age and gender requirements are very minimal. What is most important to us is the ability to copy in as much detail as possible. Details is in the eye, not in the brain, so qualification for this particular work are unimportant. What is important is that all your applicants have a full and valid international passport as this will be required of course in order to come to my country to work.

I will forward the map data shortly.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Abu Moses
Date: January 28, 2006

Dear Mr. Moses,

As I promised, you will find attached the sample maps for each of the six people you have told me that are interested in our positions.

Here are the instructions for submitting the test samples:

You will find attached to this email a large detailed images of random map pages. You will be required to duplicate these map images in as much detail as you possible can BY HAND ONLY.

It is of extreme importance that the finished work is large and clear and represents the original images as closely as possible. I shall leave the size of the map you recreate to your own choice, however the bigger and more detailed you are able to make it the better for us.

Because of the size and the detail of the images you may of course require multiple sheets of paper to reproduce them, that is fine so long as the main rule that detail is kept as close to the original as possible. Depending on the size of the piece of paper you are working on of course you may require multiple pieces to recreate the entire maps. If this is the case then of course you can scan each completed piece separately and send them each by email attachment and we will ensure the scans are pasted together correctly.

You will notice the attached maps are in colour. You may if you wish reproduce the maps in black & white, however it will be looked on more favourably if you are able to reproduce the map in multiple colours. The colours DO NOT have to match the original image exactly though.

When you have completed the hand drawn version of the maps you will then need to scan the pages IN HIGH QUALITY to that the image or images you send back to us by email attachment of LARGE and CLEAR.

On receipt of the completed scans the work will be evaluated and if it is of an acceptable standard then you will be immediately invited over to our offices and offered a placement with us.

I hope that these instructions are understandable to you. Please inform me when you will be able to send us the completed samples.

Sincerely,

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Abu Moses
Date: February 18, 2006

Dear Mr. Moses,

Those pictures are totally unacceptable. When printed out they are only ONE INCH wide! Did you not read the scanning direction in my previous email clearly. Let me quote from my email of 28th January:

"It is of extreme importance that the finished work is large and clear and represents the original images as closely as possible. I shall leave the size of the map you recreate to your own choice, however the bigger and more detailed you are able to make it the better for us."

"When you have completed the hand drawn version of the maps you will then need to scan the pages IN HIGH QUALITY to that the image or images you send back to us by email attachment of LARGE and CLEAR."

The size of the images and the size of the files are TINY. A good HIGH QUALITY scan should be at least 2 MEGABYTES in size. The physical size of the images should be at LEAST 2,000 pixels wide. Just compare the size of the picture YOU sent with the size of the ORIGINALS I sent. In fact, I have attached your image to this email, and my image to this email. It will be quite obvious to you how inadequate your image is.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Prophet Ubabuike
Date: March 9, 2006

Dear Mr. Ubabuike,

The scans that you sent to me are absolutely of DISGUSTINGLY BAD size and scan quality. You are obviously the same as your partner and have ZERO seriousness in this deal. Not only are the scans TINY, but they are mostly blurred and absolutely 100% totally unacceptable. Have I waited many weeks for such rubbish?

The maps MAY be acceptable if they were scanned correctly, but it seems to me you have employed the skills of a blind man to do them for you.

These scans are an absolute joke. They are pathetic to the extreme. Do you have any idea what the words LARGE and CLEAR actually mean? You are insulting my intelligence. Please do not waste my time any further. I have SERIOUS people to deal with who want SERIOUS jobs. I have no time for your child's play.

Just take a serious look at the rubbish you sent to me which I have attached to this email. They are absolutely TINY compared to the original images that I sent to you. Tell me, do you have a monkey in charge of the scanning? I know that you are probably not responsible for the scanning yourself, but whoever he is I suggest you get rid of that imbecile as soon as possible.

Now, I have attached your three awful images and ONE sample of the SIZE & QUALITY I am expecting from your scans. If you cannot scan anything properly then do not waste my time any further.

Look at the dimensions of the map I sent to you. It is 2800 ( TWO THOUSAND EIGHT HUNDRED) pixels wide by 3644 (THREE THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED FORTY FOUR) pixels in height. Now compare that to the scans that you send to me. Yours are TINY at just 480 pixels by 640 pixels. That is absolutely unacceptable.

If you cannot make a VAST improvement on the scan quality then I am afraid you are wasting your time and you are wasting my time.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Prophet Ubabuike
Date: March 15, 2006

Dear Mr. Ubabuike,

Thank you for at last taking a personal hand in arranging the scans. I can confirm that they have been received and are all 100% acceptable. Thank you for seeing personally to this project and you shall be rewarded for your work. All six samples have now been inspected and have been passed as completely acceptable by my board members.

What is required now is to make arrangements for these people to prepare for travel to the UK and complete a simple face-to-face verbal interview. This is nothing complicated, just a short talk to find out exactly what your people are expecting when working for us and how they think they would adapt to living in the UK.

Providing they all have no criminal records and have a full international passport then I see no reason at all why they cannot be employed by my company for the minimum required period and beyond.

What is required now is proof of their identification and official governmental identification and a signed letter from each to the effect that they are stating that there are no legal barriers preventing them from working in the UK and that they have no previous criminal record. Here in detail is what is required:

A scan of each individual's international passport.
Another form of photographic identification for our office records (this will be discussed later).
A signed letter from each of them containing their name, ages, current address and statement that there is no legal reason why they cannot enter the UK and that they have no criminal record.

Once we have received the above details then I shall authorise my board members to forward you the required advance expenses. These will include:

Flight ticket payment
clothing allowance
misc travel expenses (taxi, train etc.)
misc expenses such as food, temporary lodgings etc.

Total amount per person not to exceed US $17,435.

Please signal your agreement to the above requirements and I shall discuss with my board members what other form of photographic identification we require other than the passport scans.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Dirk Gently
To: Prophet Ubabuike
Date: April 23, 2006

Dear Mr. Ubabuike,

My name is Dirk Gently and I am the Co-Director here at SSB Systems. I am basically in charge of hiring and firing. Most people call me 'The Bastard' for short, however Mr. Gently will do. Mr. Dent is unfortunately unavailable as he is currently being sectioned under the UK Mental Health Act 1983.

Mr. Dent passed on your Circuit Diagram samples to me a short while ago so that I could pass them on to the head of our electronics division, Mr. Slarti Bartfast for examination. As soon as Mr. Bartfast had stopped laughing, he explained to me that the diagrams are without question, totally unacceptable. To quote Mr. Bartfast, "what kind of sick sick mind came up with these?".

I am afraid that it is obvious that the people who produced the diagrams have no place associating themselves with pencils and other drawing items. My advice to them would be to stand well clear of such implements so as to cause no further distress to innocent bystanders. It appears no care or time was taken over the diagrams, and indeed Slarti Bartfast pointed out that he suspects two of the diagrams may have been drawn whilst the protagonists were blindfolded. Do you have any idea why this may be the case?

The gentlemen who transcribed the previous maps appear to be of some talent however I am afraid that the people that created the Circuit Diagram images appear to be lacking even the most basic skills. In fact I need to warn you Mr. Ubabuike; We have a gentleman who visits our company about once a month who specialises in Graphology (the study of handwriting) and upon inspection of the Circuit Diagrams, he informed me that the person or persons involved may be dishonest people. Please take care Mr. Ubabuike as the graphologist told me he suspects that the people who created the diagrams maybe involved with criminal activity, and possibly even Internet fraud. I offer this advice to you as a favour. Please be careful who you are dealing with.

So, the current situation is that we can not offer the Circuit Diagram transcribing positions to these people as they are just not good enough, however with reference to the map transcribers the news is much better. I believe that for the most part they are completely acceptable, and Mr. Slarti Bartfast will be contacting you shortly to discuss the employment options for these men.

I look forward to hearing from you shortly.

In good faith,

Dirk Gently
Director
Singlesideband Systems

The gentlemen who transcribed the previous maps appear to be of
some talent however I am afraid that the people that created the
Circuit Diagram images appear to be lacking even the most basic
skills. In fact I need to warn you Mr. Ubabuike; We have a gentleman
who visits our company about once a month who specialises in Graphology
(the study of handwriting) and upon inspection of the Circuit Diagrams,
he informed me that the person or persons involved may be dishonest
people. Please take care Mr. Ubabuike as the graphologist told me
he suspects that the people who created the diagrams maybe involved
with criminal activity, and possibly even Internet fraud. I offer
this advice to you as a favour. Please be careful who you are dealing
with.
So, the current situation is that we can not offer the Circuit
Diagram transcribing positions to these people as they are just
not good enough, however with reference to the map transcribers
the news is much better. I believe that for the most part they are
completely acceptable, and Mr. Slarti Bartfast will be contacting
you shortly to discuss the employment options for these men.
I look forward to hearing from you shortly.
In good faith,
Dirk Gently
Director
Singlesideband Systems

In good faith,

Dirk Gently
Director
Singlesideband Systems

messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Prophet Ubabuike
Date: May 2, 2006

Dear Mr. Ubabuike,

After considering various reports from my company, and the lack of courtesy that you have shown to Mr. Dirk Gently (not replying to his emails etc.) I am afraid I have no other choice but to cancel any and all agreements we had, verbal or otherwise to accept any of your people for employment with this company.

Please consider your case closed at this office and I would appreciate it if you no longer waste any further of my time. I do not expect to hear from you again. The positions will now be given to more deserving people, both the map transcribing positions and also the circuit diagram transcribing positions.


Arthur Dent BSC. HHGTTG. PhD.
Director
Singlesideband Systems
